lead_paragraph: Pedals, an American black bear that walks upright, has stirred passions in northern New Jersey, where some want him put in a sanctuary and others think he should remain free.

headline.print_headline: Does an Upright-Walking Bear Need a Hand? A Debate in New Jersey
headline.main: Debate in New Jersey: Is Bear That Walks Upright Suffering, or Thriving?

snippet: Pedals, an American black bear that walks upright, has stirred passions in northern New Jersey, where some want him put in a sanctuary and others think he should remain free....
abstract: American black bear that has been seen roaming northern New Jersey on his hind legs after his front legs were maimed has ignited debate between those who would see him put in wildlife refuge and those who say let him be; New Jersey's Div of Fish and Wildlife has said on their website that bear, which appears to be active and healthy, will remain undisturbed.
